posts.post_content: Get a few extra Sporers in and this thing can be incredibly useful. Add in that other Sporers can give it +1/+1 boosts and hopefully it'll be able to last you all game. You can get a heck of a lot of Mana in one turn with this baby.
posts.html:

Posted By: NARFNra (10/28/2010 8:57:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great card, incombination with Fists of Ironwood and/or Fecundity.  
  
Say you have 5 saprolings and Fecundity in play. You sac them all, draw five cards and get five mana, allowing you to play almost everything you've drawn.   
  
I've drawn over a half of my deck in a turn like this (with Mycoloth out).

Rating:

posts.post_content:
Its just a 5/5  
  
What do you want your creatures to do?  
  
He costs 1, and has 2 toughness, although in all honesty that never seems to be great enough (I'm not going into power creep here, but just from what I've noticed, power 1 creatures aren't around most standard decks anymore, that's just what I've seen)  
  
He makes mana, its not what he does best, but any color, and he can help you out.  
  
He makes chumps, its not what he does best, but many threats, he can help you out.  
  
All of his abilities are somewhat smaller than wanted, but when you put 3, on a 1 cost?  
  
He is adorable too, not like hug, just nice to look at and ... think of hugging.

posts.post_content: lol! yes indeed.. and dangit this would be like the perfect card except that its not remove spore counter for 1 mana its remove saproling.. frankly thats to slow. Even if I play it on turn 1, I can't put out a saproling to sacrifice until turn 3. By turn 3 I could have played a utopia tree, a utopia sprawl, lotus cobra, druid of the anima, or fertile ground. If you have no other things to play on turn 1 I guess it does have that benefit though.
